definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: Soon, the villa came the dull sound of dogs barking a few.
sentences.chinese: 不一會兒，別墅裏傳出數聲沉悶的狗叫聲。

sentences.english: I dare say you're dull at home.
sentences.chinese: 我敢說你在家裏感到沉悶無聊。

sentences.english: The demon let out a muffled gargle.
sentences.chinese: 這個魔鬼發出沉悶的漱口的聲音。

sentences.english: Braveheart is a good movie, but it is slow in some parts.
sentences.chinese: 《英雄本色》是一部好電影，可是有些部份蠻沉悶的。

sentences.english: The lights of the houses gleamed dully on the hillside.
sentences.chinese: 那些房屋的燈光沉悶地閃現在山邊。

sentences.english: It was a fun movie, but the ending was rather somber.
sentences.chinese: 這是一部有趣的電影，不過結局有點沉悶。

sentences.english: The polishing agents have minimal cut and finish without any micro marring or dullness.
sentences.chinese: 拋光劑的最小割和完成翻沒有任何微型或沉悶。

sentences.english: Theyhave many friends and don’t have dull conversations.
sentences.chinese: 他們有許多朋友，交談不會陷入沉悶。

sentences.english: Northanger Abbey turns out to be quite dull, having been fixed up by General Tilney.
sentences.chinese: 諾桑覺寺竟然十分沉悶，被固定了一般蒂爾尼。

sentences.english: A lazy man's life is dull and spiritless.
sentences.chinese: 一個懶惰的人＇的生活單調和沉悶。

sentences.english: Flowers can bring happy to life.
sentences.chinese: 花能給沉悶的房間帶來生氣。

sentences.english: The hours drag along, tediously enough .
sentences.chinese: 時間慢慢地熬過，相當沉悶。

sentences.english: But dullness never quite darkens the whole planet.
sentences.chinese: 但是沉悶從來不會使整個地球變得暗淡。

sentences.english: The chairman droned on for hours.
sentences.chinese: 主席一直以沉悶的語調講了幾小時。

sentences.english: The party seemed to switch her off.
sentences.chinese: 那次聚會看來使她感到沉悶。

sentences.english: Somewhere far away a rocket bomb exploded with a dull, reverberating roar.
sentences.chinese: 遠處什麼地方爆炸了一枚火箭彈，炸聲沉悶震耳。

definition: to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
nothing much changes (idiom); always the same/stuck in a rut
dignity/face (as in "losing face")/honorable/creditable/(of sb's appearance) presentable/respectable
